summary: This is a chain of internal emails from October 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing a Daily News reporter's inquiry about why SDNY did not pursue the Jeffrey Epstein case in 2016. The reporter's email details a 2016 meeting where victims' attorneys pitched an investigation to an AUSA, and a later 2016 meeting about pursuing perjury charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Victims' Attorneys Pitch Epstein Case to SDNY
events.description: Attorneys Stan Pottinger, Brad Edwards, and Peter Skinner met with then-AUSA to pitch an investigation of the Epstein scheme. The AUSA raised questions about venue, the NPA, and statutes of limitations.

events.title: Attorneys Pitch Maxwell Perjury Case to SDNY

events.title: Daily News Story Inquiry
events.description: Reporter Stephen Brown emails SDNY with questions for a story about why the office did not pursue the Epstein case or perjury charges in 2016.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Victims' attorneys formally pitched an Epstein investigation to the SDNY in February 2016, but the effort 'went nowhere.'
In August/September 2016, attorneys David Boies and Stan Pottinger pitched SDNY on charging Ghislaine Maxwell with perjury, which also was not pursued at that time.
The SDNY's internal email discussion in 2020 shows staff acknowledging they have no knowledge of a second meeting about perjury charges and are unsure how to push back on the reporter's story.
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense has claimed she was the victim of a 'perjury trap' set by Boies in cahoots with SDNY, relating to the perjury counts in her criminal case.
The SDNY ultimately opened an investigation under U.S. Attorney Berman after the Miami Herald articles, which changed the course of the case.
